channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose ironwork, 1st November
item.description:
Irdon work opposite nursing station ( Tesco side of road) is loose and rattles with each vehicle that passes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 102 Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown

item.title: Blocked drain, 31st October
item.description:
Drain on Warden Hill Road is full of mud and worms, near turning into Bournside Close off Warden Hill Road. The drain on the corner of Bournside Close is totally blocked too, and that's been reported numerous times over the past few years; unfortunately, to no effect.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 20 Warden Hill Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken glass in lane between Cobham Road and Swindon Road, 28th October
item.description:
Over the course of the summer, people have broken glass alcohol bottles in the lane and even though it has been pushed to the sides there is a large build-up of glass in amongst the weeds. THere is also glass all over the pavement near the Swindon Road entrance to the lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 31 Cobham Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety rail missing from footbridge, 28th October
item.description:
The safety rail has fallen off or been removed from the footbridge over the river Chelt at St. Judes Walk/Charlton Park. It was lying at the side of the footpath so I have placed it out of sight underneath the bridge to hopefully stop it being used as a weapon, pole vault, kaber, etc. Without the rail being there the bridge is a danger to small children, dogs and drunks crawling home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 12 Saint Judes Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Obscured speed limit signs, 27th October
item.description:
Hedge rows and trees are blocking visibility of the speed limit signs along the Winchcombe Road, Brockhampton around Cotehay farmhouse. An increasing number of drivers are ignoring the limit
Report on FixMyStreet
